Daring Fireball: The Information on What Went Wrong With Siri

The gist of The Information‚Äôs story is that Siri has existed for seven years without cohesive leadership or product vision, and the underlying technology is a mishmash of various systems that don‚Äôt work well together.

No one commenting on Siri‚Äôs quality is discussing that Siri was moved under Craig Federighi‚Äôs supervision just 6 months ago. I‚Äôm hoping this leads to much more cohesive leadership and product vision, and will be what is laid out for us at WWDC this year.

14 Mar 2018

After listening to today‚Äôs episode of Connected, I want to throw out my guesses for what Apple‚Äôs laptop line will look like if this new rumored 13‚Äù MacBook Air comes out.

MacBook

After hearing the rumors, I think the 12‚Äù MacBook will stick around and the new laptop will be called the 13‚Äù MacBook. While this is closer in screen size than the 11 and 13‚Äù MacBook Airs were, I think the differentiator will be the thickness and power. If Apple is going to use the chip class of the Air and MacBook Escape, they can‚Äôt possibly do that in the thin body of the current MacBook. But I think they need to keep the current sized MacBook around for people whose primary need is something small and light.

MacBook Pro

Speaking of the MacBook Escape, I think this is the computer that goes away. This leaves the Pro line of MacBooks with only the 13‚Äù and 15‚Äù models with Touchbar. It seems like the Escape was Apple‚Äôs attempt to replace the Air, and it hasn‚Äôt succeeded. If this new 13‚Äù model fills that space, why would the Escape need to exist?

This is all of course conjecture. I really just want to be able to say I was right on the off chance I turn out to be come June.

I‚Äôd say it was a successful birthday

13 Mar 2018

I just came home to find my wife listening to music through our Bose Soundlink Mini set right next to our HomePod.

Even though the HomePod has Apple Music and we have a family account, it can‚Äôt access her personalized playlists. She also hates Airplay because of the delay. So for now, she refuses to use the HomePod.

While I love the HomePod for me, in fact, I would love several mini HomePods around the house, the main issue I have is the multi-person support.

My wife and I have a shared grocery list in Reminders that she can‚Äôt access when I‚Äôm not home. Our Echo Dot can via IFTTT.

I‚Äôm all in on HomePod. I just wish my family could be too.

12 Mar 2018

Legend

On Tuesday, my sweet grandfather, Gordon Craig, passed away. He was a month shy of his 90th birthday, and was one of the kindest, funniest men I‚Äôve ever met. I‚Äôm lucky to have been his grandson, and that I can carry his name in mine.

I‚Äôm proud to say I also received the teaching gene from him and my grandmother. Both taught in their small town school, and Grandpa was also a basketball coach and principal. He retired right around when I was born though, so I never got to experience what he was like in that role.

Last night we had his visitation, and I was amazed as literally hundreds of former students came to honor my Grandpa. There were legitimate class reunions happening in the chapel. Each of them spoke to me and shared the impact my grandparents both had on their lives. One man even said to me ‚ÄúMr. Craig was a legend around here.‚Äù

I‚Äôm so thankful for the life my Grandpa lived, the lives he touched, the legacy he leaves, and most of all that he is with Jesus today and no longer suffering. I pray that I can be a fraction of the man, teacher, and legend he was.
